content.question: A horizontal rod is supported at each end by ropes <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which are attached to the rod at points <math alttext="P " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, as shown in the figure. The two ropes have negligible mass, and the rod has a nonuniform mass distribution such that the rodâ€™s center of mass is at point <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the center of the rod. The rod remains horizontal. Which of the following vectors could represent the tensions <math alttext="T sub 1 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="T sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in ropes <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, and the weight <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the rod?

choices.label: The figure presents three arrows. The first two arrows are pointing vertically upward. One arrow is labeled T sub 1, and the other arrow is labeled and T sub 2. The third arrow is pointing vertically downward, and is labeled W. The arrow labeled W is three times the size of the arrows labeled T sub 1 and T sub 2.

The figure presents three arrows. The first arrow is pointing vertically upward and is labeled T sub 1. The second arrow is pointing vertically upward and is labeled T sub 2. The arrow labeled T sub 2 is two times the size of the arrow labeled T sub 1. The third arrow pointing vertically downward, and is labeled W. The arrow labeled W is three times the size of the arrow labeled T sub 1.

The figure presents three arrows. The first arrow is pointing vertically upward and is labeled T sub 1. The second arrow is pointing vertically upward and is labeled T sub 2. The arrow labeled T sub 1 is two times the size of the arrow labeled T sub 2. The third arrow pointing vertically downward, and is labeled W. The arrow labeled W is three times the size of the arrow labeled T sub 2.

The figure presents three arrows. The first arrow is pointing vertically upward and is labeled T sub 1. The second arrow is pointing vertically upward and is labeled T sub 2. The third arrow pointing vertically downward, and is labeled W. The arrows labeled T sub 1 and W are equal in size, and are both two thirds the size of the arrow labeled T sub 2.

The figure presents three arrows. The first two arrows are pointing vertically upward. One arrow is labeled T sub 1, and the other arrow is labeled and T sub 2. The third arrow is pointing vertically downward, and is labeled W. All three arrows are equal in size.

content.answer: The figure presents three arrows. The first arrow is pointing vertically upward and is labeled T sub 1. The second arrow is pointing vertically upward and is labeled T sub 2. The arrow labeled T sub 2 is two times the size of the arrow labeled T sub 1. The third arrow pointing vertically downward, and is labeled W. The arrow labeled W is three times the size of the arrow labeled T sub 1.
